page.title: 03THE METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: The{Methodist Chapel,}situated in Hulland Village was a built in 1821 and celebrated its centenery in 1921. It was built by{William Bourne,}who went round and{preached}about the{Lord {and his Gospels.}It has got a{double {keyboard electronic organ}with eight different sounds. The chapel holds {ninety people.}Every first Thursday in the month at 3.00pm the women in the village hold a{monthly meeting}to organise what will happen in the next month. Every Sunday at 6.30pm they hold a{Sunday Service}and round about thirty people attend. The people who live down the lane look after{the keys and clean up the chapel every Monday and Friday, and assist in the services every week and month.
